scope_of_work.problem: Kyndryl Legal team have requested some secure space at Greenford
scope_of_work.scope:
CCTV camera, locate inside the room facing the door to take the entry image.
Suitable Abloy key lock/deadbolt. Key to be stored in Traka Cabinet.
Window frosting – full length in line with other meeting rooms on the floor. Is to be of similar style and design.
AACS (Access Control System) card reader fitted to door frame. (If unable to be wired in, the CCTV camera takes priority and will prove entry and times).
Due to restrictions on the manufacture and country of origin of some equipment, please forward details to me of both during the quote phase.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Kyndryl UK Legal will not have secure space to store confidential materials

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value

scope_of_work.problem: Phase 1 Cooling tower 2B, has Fan propellers cracked and Failing Bearings on the Twin Fan.
scope_of_work.scope:
Both Fans on Cooling Tower 2B twin fan require stripping out and one then requires a complete new set up (fans, shaft, 
 bearings, bushes) installing whilst the second section of the twin fan requires stripping down and then rebuilt with new bearings and bushes.
scope_of_work.justification: The cooling towers are a vital part to the running of the data centre, if the cooling tower is offline this could impact with the resilience of the site.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: The data centre is at a high possibility of losing resilience on site, especially as when warmer months begin as ALL cooling towers daily run at maximum output.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Flo Hodkiewicz (2):rejected by Flo Hodkiewicz (3):offer submitted by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Twin fan on Cooling Tower 2B, has broken fan blades on the on side of the twin fan section, and on the other side of the twin fan the bearings have broken down and are now very noisy whilst running.
scope_of_work.scope:
Twin fan requires a full strip down on both sections, New shaft, 2 fan propeller bearings bushes and pulleys require replacing on the fan propeller side and then the other section requires a full strip down so the shaft bearings and bushes can be replaced, old fan propellers on this section will be re used.
all works will then be tested.
scope_of_work.justification: The cooling towers help keep Phase 1 of the Data Centre running at the correct levels.  If the cooling tower is not operational that will then impact the resilience of phase 1 on site. In warmer months all cooling towers run at full capacity to keep the Data Centre operating within the correct guidelines.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Phase 1 of the data centre will lose resilience and could fail when called upon.

input.project_name: UPM-Kyndryl Warwick Installation of Cabling between Q2C & LAN 1G1 for wifi Network
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Miss Maymie Sporer (2):offer approved by Miss Maymie Sporer (3):offer submitted by Miss Maymie Sporer (4):work in progress by Miss Maymie Sporer

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: CIO have request a Cat6a SFTP Cable to be installed from Q2C (Quote to Cash) to LAN Room 1G1 to in the Castle Area (IBM Space) at the Warwick location. This is to allow for the separation of the wifi network at Warwick between Kyndryl and IBM
scope_of_work.scope:
Supply and install 1 x 100mtrs Cat6a SFTP Cable from the Q2C office (adjacent to CBRE office) to an existing Data Cabinet (TBC) located within LAN Room 1G1.

The Cat6a SFTP Cable will be installed at High level and secured where possible onto the existing cable containment infrastructure along the cable route.
Proposed cable route, from Q2C into main corridor, along corridor left into newly formed link corridor, straight down the main corridor towards the entrance passing Tape Library, HW4 and the Pantry, Turn left across Male toilet, HW1 corridor into MP14 office area and then into LAN Room 1G1.
We have allowed 1 x FM45/C6A Male field plug termination at the WAP module position.
We have allowed 1 x Female C6A termination at the Patch Panel position.
Installation of WAP Point to ceiling in Q2C (WAP to be provided by CIO)
WAP to be fixed to ceiling in Q2C and cable to be dressed up to vUA switch located within the rack in LAN Room 1G1
scope_of_work.justification: If this work is not performed then the wifi network to Q2C will be lost when the networks are split between IBM & Kyndryl
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: As Justification - if not approved then wifi network at the location will not be able to be split between IBM & Kyndryl

input.project_name: UPM-Clean and disinfection of cold water tank. Removal of Redundant Dead Leg Pipework
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Brando Dooley DDS (2):rejected by Brando Dooley DDS (3):offer submitted by Brando Dooley DDS

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: During First Environment site audit dead leg pipework has been identified and a requirement for the cold water tank to be cleaned and disinfected.
scope_of_work.scope:
T&S Pipework to attend site To undertake a detailed survey of the dead legs to be removed (Normal Hours Working)
• Isolation of cold-water tank
• Drain down the pipework only as required
• Remove cold water dead legs as identified in the First Environmental Legionella Risk
Assessment photographic montage
• Cut out the existing dead leg connections at the mains and installing pipework and fittings
to make good, fittings to be either crimped or push fit
• To install where required Armaflex type insulation.

Wcs to attend site clean and disinfect cold water tank.
scope_of_work.justification: Dead legs increase the risk of biofilm forming and creating the right conditions for Legionella, Pseudomonas and other waterborne pathogens to proliferate; thereby increasing the health risk to anyone using the water system.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Dead legs experience periods of no flow which leads to stagnation. Redundant pipework is a persistent and often critical source of risk within water systems.

The problem statement indicates: During Specialist contractor site audit dead leg pipework has been identified and a requirement for the cold water tank to be cleaned and disinfected.. The defined scope of work includes: Specialist contractor to attend site To undertake a detailed survey of the dead legs to be removed (Normal Hours Working)
 Isolation of cold-water tank
Drain down the pipework only as required
Remove cold water dead legs as identified in the First Environmental Legionella Risk
Assessment photographic montage
Cut out the existing dead leg connections at the mains and installing pipework and fittings
to make good, fittings to be either crimped or push fit
To install where required Armaflex type insulation.

Specialist contractor to attend site to clean and disinfect cold water tank.. The justification provided is: Dead legs increase the risk of biofilm forming and creating the right conditions for Legionella, Pseudomonas and other waterborne pathogens to proliferate; thereby increasing the health risk to anyone using the water system.. If not approved, the effect would be: Dead legs experience periods of no flow which leads to stagnation. Redundant pipework is a persistent and often critical source of risk within water systems..

input.project_name: UPM-Kyndryl Warwick CIO Cabling RAF LITS to 1G1 & Reception to S2
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Miss Maymie Sporer (2):offer approved by Miss Maymie Sporer (3):offer submitted by Miss Maymie Sporer (4):work in progress by Miss Maymie Sporer

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
CIO have requested a Cat6a SFTP Cable to be installed from RAF LITS (CMF Area) to LAN Room 1G1 to in the Castle Area (IBM Space) at the Warwick location & existing WAP in Main Reception to be moved to IRS Area (Suite 2). This is to
allow for the separation of the wifi network at Warwick between Kyndryl and IBM.
scope_of_work.scope:
Supply and install 1 x 100mtrs Cat6a SFTP Cable from an agreed position within RAF Lits (CMF) to an existing Data Cabinet (TBC) located within LAN Room 1G1.
The Cat6a SFTP Cable will be installed at High level and secured where possible onto
the existing cable containment infrastructure along the cable route.
Proposed cable route:
From RAF Lits out into main corridor, along corridor left into newly formed link corridor,
straight down the main corridor towards the entrance passing Tape Library, HW4 and
the Pantry, Turn left across Male toilet, HW1 corridor into MP14 office area and then into
LAN Room 1G1.
We have allowed 1 x FM45/C6A Male field plug termination at the WAP module position & 1 x Female C6A termination at the Patch Panel position.
Reception Suite 2 Data Cable installation, Supply and install 1 x 20mtr pre-term Cat6a SFTP Cable from an existing Data Network
outlet installed within the Reception ceiling void position to an agreed position within Suite 2 foyer area.
The Cat6a SFTP Cable will be installed at High level and secured where possible onto
the existing cable containment infrastructure along the cable route.
Proposed cable route:
From the Data Network outlet across the ceiling void, then into Suite2 lobby area (above
the false ceiling) along to an agreed position outside the data suite access doors, WAP
unit to be mounted surface onto the ceiling tile and cable terminate directly into the WAP
Module..
We have allowed 1 x 20mtr - C6A / SFTP-LSZH RJ45/s~ RJ45/s pre-term patch lead to terminate at the Data Network outlet faceplate and at the WAP module position.
This LSQ also includes fixing of WAPs to ceiling
scope_of_work.justification: If this work is not performed then the wifi network to CMF will be lost when the networks are split between IBM & Kyndryl & the Reception WAP will be in a shared space
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: As per justification - Wifi network will not be split if works not approved
